docs.snippet: Technology is changing everything about how Americans work, but the industry is left largely unscathed by the Republican tax bill that Congress took up this week.

headline.main: What the Tax Bill Fails to Address: Technology’s Tsunami

docs.snippet: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers discuss the so-called Dreamers, incarcerated women fighting wildfires, and a nurse arrested in Utah.

headline.main: ‘We Are Not Criminals, We Are Prisoners’

docs.snippet: Renee DiResta has been tracking disinformation on Facebook and other sites since the anti-vaccine movement. Congress turned to her for the grilling of tech executives.

headline.print_headline: An Expert In Pajamas,  Battling Bots
headline.main: She Warned of ‘Peer-to-Peer Misinformation.’ Congress Listened.

docs.snippet: American tech companies positioned themselves as entities that brought positive change by connecting people and spreading information. Perceptions are shifting.

headline.print_headline: Changing the World, but Not Quite the Way They Had Imagined
headline.main: Tech Giants, Once Seen as Saviors, Are Now Viewed as Threats

docs.snippet: In this week’s tech newsletter, the tech giants battle Washington’s regulatory fervor. Also, Lyft gets a lot of money, and Google may remake Toronto.

headline.print_headline: Farhad and Mike’s Week in Tech: Regulation Is Looming
headline.main: Farhad and Mike’s Week in Tech: Regulation Is Looming

docs.snippet: A new program, aided by companies like Facebook, will aim to teach students how to recognize and stop the sharing of fake news and conspiracy theories.

headline.print_headline: Taught in Italy: Reading, Math And Fake News
headline.main: In Italian Schools, Reading, Writing and Recognizing Fake News

docs.snippet: Lawyers for Google, Facebook and Twitter will discuss Russian meddling in the 2016 presidential election and the Federal Reserve could get a new leader.

headline.print_headline: Tech Giants in Hearings; Jobs and Earnings Data
headline.main: Tech Companies Face Congress, Fed News and Jobs Numbers

docs.snippet: Facebook, Google and Amazon are coming under increasing pressure by regulators concerned about their growing power.

headline.print_headline: Pressure Is Growing To Rein In Tech Titans
headline.main: Internet Giants Face New Political Resistance in Washington

docs.snippet: With a crucial Communist Party meeting just weeks away, Beijing is further tightening its already formidable internet controls.

headline.print_headline: China Blocks WhatsApp, Tightening Its Online Grip
headline.main: China Blocks WhatsApp, Broadening Online Censorship

docs.snippet: The congressional intelligence committees are investigating Russian interference in the election and want to know more about how social media was used to sow discord and spread misinformation.

headline.main: House Intelligence Committee Releases Incendiary Russian Social Media Ads
